questionsData.title: Sound needs a substance to travel through vacuum .
questionsData.explain_answer: Unlike light waves, sound waves need a substance to travel through , Sound waves require a medium, such as air, water, or metal, to vibrate and propagate.

questionsData.title: Matter is used to describe what things are made of.
questionsData.explain_answer: The word "matter" refers to anything that has mass and takes up space. Everything in our physical world, from tiny dust particles to giant stars, is considered matter. So, matter is indeed used to describe what things are made of.

questionsData.article: Gravity is the attraction between two objects, Every object on Earth is attracted toward the center of Earth. Gravity is what keeps us on the ground, Without it, we would drift into space. The force between Earth and you is greater than the force between the moon and you, You would weigh less on the moon, because the moon has less mass than Earth has. The moon is attracted toward Earth. The force that exists between Earth and the moon is gravitational attraction. This force keeps the moon orbiting Earth. The moon revolves around Earth. Isaac Newton was the first person to explain the effect of gravity upon our universe, He used mathematical formula to prove that gravity is what keeps the planets in orbit, Since Newton's discoveries, we have learned a great deal about the effects of gravity. We know that, because of gravity, the moon orbits Earth. And also because of gravity, Earth revolves around the sun. gravity affects all the planets in the solar system as well as the sun.

questionsData.title: I found ….. rotten orange on the table.
Is your car the same ………. as ours?
..... Aref is busy, he spends some time with his family.
They drove to work …..
questionsData.explain_answer:
They drove to work  fast .

fast is an adverb that describes the speed of their driving. It indicates that they were driving quickly .

  • Faster: This comparative form suggests a higher degree of speed than "fast." However, in this context, "faster" may not be the most appropriate choice because it implies a comparison with a previous speed or another vehicle's speed, which is not indicated in the sentence.

  • Slowly: This adverb suggests a low or reduced speed. However, in the given sentence, the intention was to go work so driving slowly would be counterproductive.

  • Fastest: This superlative form indicates the highest degree of speed among multiple options. However, in the sentence, there is no comparison or reference to other vehicles or speeds, so using "fastest" would not be suitable.

questionsData.title: While he was doing his homework , his mother …. lunch.
questionsData.explain_answer: The structure "while + past continuous" is often used in combination with the past simple tense to express two  actions in the past.

questionsData.title: I …… him since 2000
Are you ……in today's workshop?
Sana'a,.............I live is my best city.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The best option to fill in the blank in the sentence "Sana'a,.............I live is my best city" is where.

Here's why:

  • Where is used to refer to a place. In this case, you are stating that Sana'a is the place where you live and consider it your best city.
  • Which is used to choose between two or more options. There's no implication of choosing in this sentence.
  • Who and whom are used to refer to people. Since Sana'a is not a person, these options wouldn't be appropriate.

So the complete sentence would be:

Sana'a, where I live, is my best city.
